meaningMnemonic:
This is a <kanji>build</kanji> <kanji>thing</kanji>, or perhaps a <kanji>build</kanji>ing <kanji>thing</kanji>. In other words, a <vocabulary>building</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>structure</vocabulary>. 

建物 is a very general word that can refer to any kind of building, including residential buildings, commercial buildings, or public facilities.
readingMnemonic: The reading might look a little strange, but makes sense once you get it. You already know that the verb 建てる means "to build", and that a もの is a "thing". Now just remove the る part from the verb to make it a noun, combine it with もの, and we get <reading>たてもの</reading>! Just remember that it’s all kun’yomi since it comes from the verb 建てる.
